questions.text: Risk factor for carcinoma breast: (PGI Nov. 2014) A. Nulliparity B. OCP C. Family history D. BRCA-1 mutation E. Estrogen

Which of the following cancer is least associated with genetic and familial cause?
Types of fibroadenosis most likely to undergo malignant change is: (LQ)
Risk factor for carcinoma breast: (LQ)
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Option C (Jewish origin) Explanation: (Based on your premise, although contrary to general medical knowledge) While typically Ashkenazi Jewish origin is associated with a higher prevalence of BRCA1/2 mutations (which are significant breast cancer risk factors), if, within your specific context, this is considered a false statement regarding breast cancer risk, then it would be incorrect.
  • • Option D (All) Explanation: Since option A (and based on your premise, C) is considered incorrect, "All" cannot be the correct answer as not all listed options are true risk factors.
